benchmark_details.name: ES-KT-24 (Multimodal Knowledge Tracing Benchmark Dataset)
benchmark_details.overview: ES-KT-24 is a novel multimodal Knowledge Tracing dataset for intelligent tutoring systems in educational game contexts, incorporating game-playing videos, synthetically generated question text, and detailed game logs.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To support KT research and broader studies in Learning Analytics by providing a benchmark for knowledge tracing using game data.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: The dataset relies solely on duration time as the indicator of answer correctness, which may oversimplify interactions.

data.source: Game logs collected from educational gameplay sessions and synthetic text generated using GPT-4o.
data.annotation: Synthetic question text generated through language models and manual curation.

methodology.calculation: Performance was evaluated using AUC and Accuracy scores based on KT model predictions.
methodology.interpretation: Models are assessed based on their ability to predict student performance on unseen questions.
methodology.baseline_results: SimpleKT demonstrated the best performance with an AUC of 0.7366 and ACC of 0.6709.
methodology.validation: Results reported as mean values and standard deviations from multiple runs.

targeted_risks.demographic_analysis: The dataset includes users from various backgrounds and languages.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: Data processed to ensure anonymity of students and prevent personal identification.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.data_licensing: Released under the CC BY-NC 4.0 license.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.consent_procedures: Gameplay videos were recorded by researchers to protect privacy.
